item.title: Donald add a quote by Philippe Soupault
Donald add a quote by Juan Carlos Onetti
item.description: "And this is more or less all that I had left after the holidays. Nothing really; hopeless confusion, a narrative without a possible conclusion, full of doubtful meanings, belied by the very elements that I had to give it shape. I didn't know the significance of what I'd seen, I was repelled by the idea of finding out and being sure. All that counts is that I felt at peace when I finished writing, certain I had enjoyed the greatest success one can expect from this kind of task: I had accepted a challenge, and turned at least one daily defeat into a victory." -- Juan Carlos Onetti

item.title: Donald add a quote by Rainer Werner Fassbinder
item.description: "I detest the idea that love between two persons can lead to salvation. All my life I have fought against this oppressive type of relationship. Instead, I believe in searching for a kind of love that somehow involves all of humanity." -- Rainer Werner Fassbinder
